channel.title: Need some help (RAM)
channel.description:
Well, for christmas I got 1GB of ram, i put it in and it says that i have 1GB of ram, before i had 256 and just to turn the computer on nothing running there would be about 170 left.
I have a program that shows how much ram is being used and how much is left etc, well with my 1GB in and no programs running i only have average 650, I don't think it takes 500 to have the computer on now and before it took 50 with 256.
Does this mean i put it in wrong or it installed wrong because it does not "Keep" it at 1GB?

No, its Windows.

Lets get back on topic.

No, its windows.

No, its winblows.
[/quote]
No, its loseblows.[/quote]

item.title: Need some help (RAM)
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:39629”][quote author=Cheatest link=topic=55629.msg688313#msg688313 date=1167185946]

You mean you have an average of 650 left, or 650 total?

About 650 left is normal (at least for me). I’m assuming Windows sees that you have more RAM, so it pushes less stuff into virtual memory, and more into physical RAM. But I am not positive.

Thanks much thats what i mean i have 650 left, well i guess thats pretty dumb atleast it is enough to play WoW.
[/quote]
windows is very dumb.[/quote]
No, that’s not very dumb, it uses more of your physical RAM, and RAM is MUCH faster than your hard drive. More RAM basically gives Windows more room to “play”.

Read full topic

It’s an alternative to Windows that runs .EXE files. Just go to reactos.org or google reactos if you want to know more about it.
